Description: A small pottery flask with oval body, small flattened base, low neck and everted rim, and a single handle. The body is divided into two unequal sections by two grooves. The main section is decorated in relief by a double swag with pendent loops; within the curve of the swag are two lotus buds. Below, rising from the base, is a series of long overlapping pointed leaves. The same decoration is found on both sides. Two-piece mould. Pinkish-buff marl ware, with a mid-brown slip.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Ptolemaic, second or first century BC. Comparandum: Close, probably same mould-series: Schmidt 1997: no. 166, dated first to second century AD.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3653)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
